headline: Airline stocks slip on continued delays, Beyond Meat stock falls
summary: Josh Lipton recaps three of the top stories on Wall Street as part of Yahoo Finance's Market Minute. Nvidia (NVDA) and CoreWeave (CRWV) are some of the tech stocks in the red during Tuesday's session. Airline stocks, like Delta Air Lines (DAL), United (UAL), and American (AAL), are under pressure as flight delays are expected to continue beyond the government shutdown. Beyond Meat (BYND) stock tumbles after issuing a weak outlook. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: SoftBank Sells Nvidia Stake for $5.8 Billion to Fund AI Bets
summary: Founder Masayoshi Son has been unwinding positions to pay for a plethora of AI projects, from Stargate data centers with OpenAI and Oracle Corp. to robot manufacturing sites in the US.  The Nvidia exit coincides with a growing debate about whether spending by big tech firms like Meta Platforms Inc. and Alphabet Inc. — expected to surpass $1 trillion in coming years — will produce commensurate returns.

headline: Stocks mixed as tech titans struggle
summary: Global stocks turned in a mixed performance on Tuesday as tech shares struggled and a rally on optimism over a deal to end the US government shutdown faded.Equities generally started the week on the front foot after US lawmakers reached a deal to reopen the government which has been shutdown for more than 40 days, adding to a revival of demand for tech giants despite growing fears of an AI bubble.

headline: Tech Weekly: precious chip deals, precious metals
summary: STORY: From precious chip deals to precious metals.This is Tech Weekly.:: Tech WeeklyNvidia CEO Jensen Huang said the company has seen "very strong demand" for its advanced Blackwell chips.And it's producing the semiconductors with the help of TSMC's wafers.Huang even said Nvidia's success wouldn't be possible without the Taiwanese firm's support on wafers.Nvidia made history last month when it became the first company to reach a $5 trillion market value.Apple won't release the next version of the iPhone Air in the fall of 2026 as previously planned.That's according to sources familiar with the matter.The company launched the iPhone Air in 2025 as a thinner and lighter alternative within its iPhone portfolio.The model came with some trade-offs in terms of battery size and camera features.CEO Elon Musk said Tesla will likely have to build a chip fab to make AI semiconductors.And he said the EV maker could work with U.S. firm Intel.Tesla is designing its fifth-generation AI chip to power its autonomous ambitions.Musk raised the issue at the company's annual meeting."As far as I can see, the only option is to go build some very big chip fab."The AA Driving School Academy says trainee driving instructors are turning to virtual reality to master complex road scenarios in a safe, controlled environment.Using Meta’s Quest 3 headsets, the driving school can introduce instructors to modern hazards.Including a higher number of cyclists and scooters.UK startup DEScycle is dissolving discarded tech using "deep eutectic solvent" chemistry to pull out precious and critical metals at room temperature.It's an alternative to energy-hungry smelting.And DEScycle says the liquids selectively dissolve metals from shredded circuit boards and other e‑waste while leaving most non‑metal components behind.

raw.headline: Tech Weekly: precious chip deals, precious metals
raw.summary: STORY: From precious chip deals to precious metals.This is Tech Weekly.:: Tech WeeklyNvidia CEO Jensen Huang said the company has seen "very strong demand" for its advanced Blackwell chips.And it's producing the semiconductors with the help of TSMC's wafers.Huang even said Nvidia's success wouldn't be possible without the Taiwanese firm's support on wafers.Nvidia made history last month when it became the first company to reach a $5 trillion market value.Apple won't release the next version of the iPhone Air in the fall of 2026 as previously planned.That's according to sources familiar with the matter.The company launched the iPhone Air in 2025 as a thinner and lighter alternative within its iPhone portfolio.The model came with some trade-offs in terms of battery size and camera features.CEO Elon Musk said Tesla will likely have to build a chip fab to make AI semiconductors.And he said the EV maker could work with U.S. firm Intel.Tesla is designing its fifth-generation AI chip to power its autonomous ambitions.Musk raised the issue at the company's annual meeting."As far as I can see, the only option is to go build some very big chip fab."The AA Driving School Academy says trainee driving instructors are turning to virtual reality to master complex road scenarios in a safe, controlled environment.Using Meta’s Quest 3 headsets, the driving school can introduce instructors to modern hazards.Including a higher number of cyclists and scooters.UK startup DEScycle is dissolving discarded tech using "deep eutectic solvent" chemistry to pull out precious and critical metals at room temperature.It's an alternative to energy-hungry smelting.And DEScycle says the liquids selectively dissolve metals from shredded circuit boards and other e‑waste while leaving most non‑metal components behind.

headline: What is hybrid AI? Analyst explains what more companies are doing
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is hosting its analyst day at the Nasdaq on Tuesday, which could prove to be a pivotal moment as the AI chip race with competitor Nvidia (NVDA) tightens. TECHnalysis Research, LLC president Bob O'Donnell sits down with Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to explain what hybrid AI (artificial intelligence) and why he is bullish on the dynamic of hyperscalers building out AI infrastructure and investing in physical AI data centers and GPUs. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Japan's SoftBank says it has sold its shares in Nvidia for $5.8 billion
summary: Japanese technology company SoftBank Group Corp. said Tuesday that it has sold all the Nvidia Corp. shares that it owned for $5.83 billion, while it reported higher than expected profit in the first half of this fiscal year.  Tokyo-based SoftBank Group Corp. said it sold the stake in Nvidia in October.  The group’s founder, Masayoshi Son, has recently focused ambitiously on the potential of AI.

headline: $135K Mortgage and $400K Roth - Would You Take Money From Your Roth To Be Mortgage-Free? Here's What Suze Orman Says To Do
summary: Many Americans approaching retirement face a common question: should you tap into your retirement savings to pay off your mortgage? On her "Women & Money" podcast, personal finance expert Suze Orman addressed this dilemma from a listener in his early 60s, providing insight that could help others in similar situations. The Question from a Listener Jody, just shy of 64, has about $400,000 in a Roth IRA and an emergency fund. His home, which he calls his "forever home," is worth just under $1 milli

raw.headline: $135K Mortgage and $400K Roth - Would You Take Money From Your Roth To Be Mortgage-Free? Here's What Suze Orman Says To Do
raw.summary: Many Americans approaching retirement face a common question: should you tap into your retirement savings to pay off your mortgage? On her "Women & Money" podcast, personal finance expert Suze Orman addressed this dilemma from a listener in his early 60s, providing insight that could help others in similar situations. headline: TSMC Posts Slowest Growth in 18 Months Amid AI Bubble Debate
summary: TSMC posted a 16.9% rise in sales for October, the slowest pace since February 2024.  TSMC’s American depository receipts were up as much as 3% in pre-market trading.  Industry executives remain buoyant about AI-driven growth as major tech firms are accelerating investments in data centers.

headline: CoreWeave’s earnings report highlights $56 billion in contracted revenue, but its guidance and share price tick down amid AI infrastructure bubble fears
summary: All eyes were on the datacenter operator’s RPO figure, which matched Wall Street’s $50 billion-$60 billion expectations.

headline: Uber (UBER) Is Down 5.6% After Mixed Q3 Results and Autonomous Vehicle Partnership Announcements
summary: Uber Technologies recently reported third-quarter 2025 earnings, revealing US$13.47 billion in sales and US$6.63 billion in net income, alongside a series of new partnerships with Loblaw, Toast, Kroger, NVIDIA, and Script Runner to expand its delivery platform and advance autonomous vehicle initiatives. While the company’s growth and profitability drew praise, investor unease surfaced due to cautious guidance for the upcoming quarter and persistent uncertainties regarding the path to...
